did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Printed material (conference proceedings, issues of PAACE Journal of Lifelong Learning), most somehow connected with Indiana University of Pennsylvania

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: The Pennsylvania Association for Adult and Continuing Education (PAACE) was created in 1978 as a statewide professional organization which serves as an advocate for adult and continuing education. The membership includes professionals and volunteers from all aspects of adult continuing education, that is adult basic and general education, English as a second language, continuing higher education, literacy education, and workforce development. PAACE is also the publisher of The PAACE Journal of Lifelong Learning, a refereed journal published annually with the sponsorship of Indiana University of Pennsylvania.

The Midwest Research to Practice Conference in Adult, Continuing and Community Education, first held in 1981. is a two day meeting held each fall at a major university in the Midwest United States. This conference provides a forum for practitioners and researchers to discuss practices, concepts, evaluation, and research studies to improve practice in adult education.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Pennsylvania Adult Education Collection contains conference proceedings and journal issues.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Alphabetical by type or title, and within that chronological.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p:
The library holds a considerable number of collections related to adult and continuing education, which collectively are known as the
Alexander Charters Library of Resources for Educators of Adults. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete listing. Holding also contain numerous publications (books, newsletters, pamphlets, and professional journals); please refer to &summitref; to locate these items.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.
